availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Ewing Gibson (Owsley County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Owsley County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Bethany Gibson. Father of William Gibson, China Gibson, Letitia Gibson, Zacheriah Gibson, and Daniel B. Gibson. Farmer in Owsley County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Owsley County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, p. 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, p. 1.
Find A Grave, "James Ewing (April 23, 1814-July 8, 1883)," Memorial #67793257, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/67793257 (accessed September 18, 2018).
